intro: Malvastrum foliosum, commonly known as the showy milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known species like hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Malvastrum foliosum is also an important host plant for the larvae of certain butterfly species.
